biography.summary: Susan M. Collins is a United States Senator from Maine, serving since 1997. She is known for her bipartisan approach, fiscal conservatism, and influential role on national appropriations matters.
biography.education: St. Lawrence University, B.A. in Government.
biography.career: Prior to joining the Senate, Collins held roles in public service and policy work, including positions within Maine's governmental and public sectors.

contact.office_address: 413 Dirksen Senate Office Building, Washington DC 20510
